column4: Hi, when trying to install a certain required lib, I get this error: http://paste.ubuntu.com/39715/  - how to fix it ?
have you checked your sources?
no, where and what to look for ?
what version are you running?
ubuntu 804
that version has 264-57, why dont you use the later version?
I don't know. It is required by cinelerra. I am unable to install cinelerra because I am missing the lib
I dont see that application in ubuntu.  Are you sure that is available for ubuntu?
yes, but I had to add a line in Software Sources
mk, so, those software sources, that the "sources" that I was refering to earlier
this: http://cvs.cinelerra.org/docs/split_manual_en/cinelerra_cv_manual_en_2.html#SEC24
the sources seems to appear yes
wana pastebin your sources.list?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/39725/
how about the /etc/apt/sources.list.d/akirad.list
http://paste.ubuntu.com/39727/
ok, that file is wrong
it is setup for gutsy, and you are running hardy
try this website:  it might make it allot easier
http://akiradproject.net/repository
I tried to run the commands as stated on the link you pasted me, but the second command gave me this: http://paste.ubuntu.com/39732/
I can't access http://akirad.hfbk.net/ in FireFox either
ok, I think I can help you directly
remove that package that the webpage suggested
remove the file we talked about earlier too
which package? It seems it didn't success in installing the package. Also not the lib from earlier
sudo aptitude remove --purge addakirad
done
did you remove that extra source file?
you mean akirad.list ?
yes: sudo rm ï»¿/etc/apt/sources.list.d/akirad.list
yes
ok, open up your sources.list with an editor, and start by removing the last three lines, something about k9
k9copy
done
add the contents of this webpage to the bottom: http://repository.akirad.net/dists/hardy.list
done
save, close, and try the install again
now it is gone from Synaptic
refresh?
is it working?
reloading... -> http://paste.ubuntu.com/39735/
that should be gone, hmmm, try opening up synaptic, and checking your sources there
where in synaptic ?
i found
there is one new there under uiniverse, called "repository.akirad.net/main". Packages: akiradnews. That's the only one.
can you pastebin your sources.list again?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/39739/
mmmm, more problems I see
why dont you delete your sources.list, and then use System > Admin > Software Sources to recreate it
a general suggestion: make a separate /home partition, and do clean installs rather than upgrades
were you able to recreate your sources.list?
I removed sources.list, and reloaded in Software Sources with this result: http://paste.ubuntu.com/39741/
er, hmmm, is your /etc/apt/soures.list.d empty?
we really need to get rid of that source.... or maybe not
http://paste.ubuntu.com/39742/
can you pastebin your sources.list again?  just so I can check?
ahahahaha, ok, lets fix that!       I think its sudo rm /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*
http://paste.ubuntu.com/39743/
should I delete all files in sources.list.d/ ?
yes, and are your sure you completely deleted that sources.list file?  the last couple lines is still out of wack
I actually renamed it
that should work too
Ok, now I have deleted the file completely + all files in sources.list.d/
ok, use the Sources GUI to regenerate it
should I try reloading again in Software Sources ?
ok
you can try reloading first.  Hopefully, NO packages show up
under ThirdParty Software? http://repository.akirad.net is here + 8 unchecked
are your soureces set?
that akirad is the only of the third-party software that is checked
well, make sure everything is unchecked in third party.  You only want the defaults.   Its weird though, how are those third parties getting in there?  I don't know  : (
uncheck, then reload ?
are the other ones checked on the other tabs?
Ubuntu Software: all checked. Updated: 2 first are checked.
great, lets save and exit, and get to a commandline
one sec!  first run sudo aptitude install ubuntu-desktop
was that for me or stat_cs, that sudo aptitude update... ?
just do sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
just to make sure
done
now run sudo aptitude update && sudo aptitude full-upgrade
is this a 2 hours command ?
only if your computer is really messed up.  If you computer is ok, it will take 30 seconds
alright. Finished
great!   it was just a check, to make sure you had a working system.  NOW, paste the lines here: http://repository.akirad.net/dists/hardy.list   into your sources.list
and try the install again, try try again
should there be no 'deb' keyword in front ?
you should paste those lines exactly
so yes, the deb keyword should be there
I reloaded in Synaptic, but still couldnt find cinelerra. In Software Sources->Third-Party, "http://akirad.cinelerra.org/ akirad-hardy main" is the only checked.
sources.list http://paste.ubuntu.com/39747/
did you reload, or update?
in synaptic, I pressed the "Reload" -button
and you are sure its not there?
2sec
Found it, and was able to install it! Thank you very much! :D
woo!  glad its working
